intro: Heptapleurum angilogense, commonly known as the African nettle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its upright growth habit and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Heptapleurum angilogense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. It is noted for its stinging hairs, which can cause irritation upon contact with the skin.
